title: Bertie Plays the Blues
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: He made his way round the circle of Moray Place and  into Darnaway Street feeling somewhat low. Elspeth's  confession of her feelings had dispirited him.

title: The Right Attitude to Rain
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: They resumed their walk up the hill. At the top of Gloucester Lane, the mews houses gave way to broader, more elegant streets, to Heriot Row and Darnaway Street. Heriot Row, which faced south, was a long sweep of Georgian terrace, with formal gardens on the other side.

title: The Unbearable Lightness of Scones
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: – and now Elspeth – lived was only two blocks away, down Darnaway Street and along a small section of Heriot Row. They were to go there when they left the wedding party, now winding down after the ceilidh band had packed up their instru­ments and the dancing had stopped.

title: The Unbearable Lightness of Scones
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: – and now Elspeth – lived was only two blocks away, down Darnaway Street and along a small section of Heriot Row. They were to go there when they left the wedding party, now winding down after the ceilidh band had packed up their instru­ments and the dancing had stopped.

title: Bertie Plays the Blues
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: He walked slowly along Darnaway Street, sunk in thought  of his conversation with Elspeth. Reaching the top of India  Street, he looked down the sloping cobbled road to the trees  and railings at the end.

title: The Importance of Being Seven
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Unaware of the eyes upon them, Matthew and Elspeth turned  the corner into Darnaway Street. "Well?" said Matthew.
